channel.title: Half-Life on a flash drive
channel.description: I heard somewhere that you could put half-life on a usb flash drive in a way that you could plug it into a computer and start playing no instillation needed. Is this possible with a 4gig and how do I do it?

item.title: Half-Life on a flash drive
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
I am currently attempting to do this with a downloaded no-steam copy of HL2, but it’s just a few megabytes to big for my flash drive. Does anybody know what files I could delete without causing any problems and remove about 100 megabytes? Maybe, if there are any, files that are only needed for running mods?

Read full topic

item.title: Half-Life on a flash drive
item.dc:creator: _ShotintheDark
item.description:
Hell, you can do it with most games now-a-days. At least, standalone singleplayer games you can. I’ve bought games, installed them on one computer, patched it all, then realized I should of done it on another, so I either just copy all the installed information to a dvd, or just to another harddrive. Either way, about 7 times out of 10, it’ll work.

Read full topic

item.title: Half-Life on a flash drive
item.dc:creator: Paddy
item.description:
It can be done with a standalone ilegal version. As sersoft said, if you own an orignal copy, then its not too bad. If not, your a very naughty boy.

Read full topic

item.title: Half-Life on a flash drive
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
garthbartin:

It seems like you all know how to do this but none of you will tell me how. ):<

Well, if you have the WON version, then I assume you can do a standalone version fairly simply.

A standalone Steam version is far more complicated and would involve a Steam emulator and other such things, the discussion of which is, I believe, verboten, since it breaks Steam’s EULA.

Read full topic
